title: Oil prices soar 10% after attack on Saudi facilities hits global supply
text: Oil prices retreated on Monday after hitting their highest since May at the open, on fears over supply disruptions following an attack on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities on Saturday that cut more than 5% of global oil supply.

title: Will The Fed Rate Cut Stall The Market's Rally?
text: The sharp rise in yields caught many by surprise and now investors as well as traders are wondering whether a rate cut this week will push stocks even higher or stall the rally. Tom Aspray takes a technical look at yields as well as the stock market.

title: BofA turns bullish on a troubled group, but there's a catch
text: Bank of America Merrill Lynch's Jill Carey Hall sees small caps outperforming large caps over the next decade.

title: The Federal Reserve is poised to deliver another rate cut
text: Happy Sunday. A version of this story first appeared in CNN Business' Before the Bell newsletter. Not a subscriber? You can sign up right here.

title: Saudi, Gulf stocks fall after attack on Aramco oil plants
text: Saudi stocks  plunged 2.3% as the market opened on Sunday, after attacks on two plants at the heart of the kingdom's oil industry a day earlier knocked out more than half of Saudi crude output.

title: Gold Correction Underway
text: Cycles point down for the gold market.

title: Oil surges, stock futures slip after attack on Saudi facility
text: Oil prices surged to six-month highs on Monday while Wall Street futures turned lower and safe haven bets returned after weekend attacks on Saudi Arabia's crude facilities knocked out more than 5% of global oil supply.

title: Explainer: Attack on Saudi leaves world without spare oil capacity
text: The strike on the heartland of Saudi Arabia's oil industry, including damage to the world's biggest petroleum-processing facility, has driven oil prices to their highest level in nearly four months.

title: Trump says US 'locked and loaded' after attack on Saudi oil supply
text: Trump said oil would be released if needed to keep the market well supplied.

title: Oil prices surge 15% after attack on Saudi facilities hits global supply
text: Oil prices surged more than 15% to their highest level in nearly four months at the open on Sunday after an attack on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities on Saturday that knocked out more than 5% of global oil supply.

title: How Trump Is Using Attacks On Saudi Arabia’s Oil To His Advantage
text: President Trump focused on his own agenda of keeping oil prices low and building oil and gas infrastructure in the United States–not confronting Iran.

title: Dow set to lose more than 100 points on fears spiking oil will slow the global economy
text: Dow Jones Industrial Average futures were down 108 points, indicating a loss of 112 points at Monday's open.

title: U.S. stock futures fall after Saudi oil attacks
text: U.S. stock futures fell 0.59% percent when trading resumed on Sunday, a day after attacks on Saudi oil facilities that risk disrupting global energy supplies.

title: Brent crude oil jumps 13% after drone strikes disrupt Saudi crude production
text: Drone strikes attacked an oil processing facility at Abqaiq and the nearby Khurais oil field on Saturday.

title: Trump authorizes release of oil from strategic petroleum reserve after Saudi attacks
text: Trump said oil would be released if needed to keep the market well supplied.

title: Attack on Saudi Oil Facility Is Seen as Short-Term Disruption
text: Experts say a severe shock to energy markets and the world economy is unlikely. They expect oil and gas prices to rise modestly, if the damage is quickly repaired.

title: S&P Global Platts sees Saudi oil strikes driving up risk premium in crude market
text: Attacks on Saudi oil plants have boosted concerns about supply security in the Middle East and should raise the risk premium in the global crude market, shifting focus from a gloomy economic backdrop, S&P Global Platts said on Sunday.

title: Attacks In Saudi Arabia Change The Game For The Oil Market, And For ARAMCO
text: Saturday’s attacks bring Saudi Arabia and Iran closer to an open confrontation, which could send oil prices skyrocketing.

title: Saudi Arabia aims to restore one-third of lost oil output by Monday, WSJ says
text: The drone strikes on facilities in Abqaiq and Khurais eliminated 5.7 million barrels of production over the weekend.

title: America has a huge stash of emergency oil. This is why
text: Three days before Christmas in 1975, President Gerald Ford signed a law creating the United States' first emergency stash of crude oil. The nation had been traumatized by an oil embargo a few years earlier.

title: Bitcoin's heading to a new all-time high along with the S&P 500, says Fundstrat's Tom Lee
text: The "Fast Money" traders share their first moves for the market open.

title: Warren’s plans for Big Tech and Big Banks are big trouble
text: Last week, Elizabeth Warren made it clear she wants to reign in the banks and Wall Street, and break up Big Tech. What dumb ideas.

title: Fed trades 'remarkably positive' for 'no precedents' after volatile year
text: A year ago, U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell held a "remarkably positive outlook" for an economy enjoying a "historically rare" combination of good news including low unemployment, steady inflation and strong growth that were all expected to continue.

title: Economy teetering on edge of recession as rates fall, analysts warn
text: Conventional wisdom has it that lower interest rates equal good news for borrowers — but that might not be the case in today’s economy. As the US interest rate falls, banks are ginning up policies that could pull the plug on American prosperity and possibly plunge the economy into a deep recession, according to some.

title: What recession? Small businesses are doing just fine
text: Small businesses aren’t listening to the recession talk as of late – they’re continuing to invest, grow and hire at historically high levels

title: Saudi stock market dives, crude futures to jump after attack on oil plants
text: Saturday's attack is the biggest on oil infrastructure anywhere since Saddam Hussein's invasion of Kuwait in 1990.
